parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

datasetStructure: One record per finding, per object, per time point, per visit per subject

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FASEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: FASEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FAGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: FAGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FASPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: FASPID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101832

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FATESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in FATEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in FATESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). FATESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SEV", "OCCUR". Note that controlled terminology is in a FATESTCD general codelist and in several therapeutic area-specific codelists.
datasetVariables.label: Findings About Test Short Name
datasetVariables.name: FATESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101833

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FATEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in FATEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Severity/Intensity", "Occurrence". Note that controlled terminology is in a FATEST general codelist and in several therapeutic area-specific codelists.
datasetVariables.label: Findings About Test Name
datasetVariables.name: FATEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FAOBJ

datasetVariables.description: Used to describe the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by --TEST. Examples: the term (e.g., "Acne") describing a clinical sign or symptom that is being measured by a severity test; an event (e.g., "VOMIT, where the volume of vomit is being measured by a VOLUME test).
datasetVariables.label: Object of the Observation
datasetVariables.name: FAOBJ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FACAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "GERD", "PRE-SPECIFIED AE".
datasetVariables.label: Category for Findings About
datasetVariables.name: FACAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FASCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of FACAT.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Findings About
datasetVariables.name: FASCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

priorVersion.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FAORRES

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariables.description: Result of the test as originally received or collected.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariables.name: FAORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FAORRESU

datasetVariables.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for FAORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Original Units
datasetVariables.name: FAORRESU

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FASTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from FAORRES in a standard format or standard units. FASTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in FASTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in FAORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning; they could be represented in standard format in FASTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: FASTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FASTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from FASTRESC. FASTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: FASTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FASTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for FASTRESC and FASTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: FASTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FASTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate that the measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in FAORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: FASTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FAREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why a question was not answered. Example: "Subject refused". Used in conjunction with FASTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Performed
datasetVariables.name: FAREASND

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FALOC

datasetVariables.description: Used to specify the location of the clinical evaluation. Example: "ARM".
datasetVariables.label: Location of the Finding About
datasetVariables.name: FALOC

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FALAT

datasetVariables.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
datasetVariables.label: Laterality
datasetVariables.name: FALAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FALOBXFL

datasetVariables.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
datasetVariables.name: FALOBXFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FABLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. Note that FABLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: FABLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FAEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "INVESTIGATOR", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "VENDOR".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: FAEVAL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: 1. Clinical encounter number. \n 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. \n 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

datasetVariables.name: TAETORD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.EPOCH

datasetVariables.description: Epoch associated with the date/time of the observation. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", "FOLLOW-UP".
datasetVariables.label: Epoch
datasetVariables.name: EPOCH

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FADTC

datasetVariables.description: Collection date and time of findings assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Collection
datasetVariables.name: FADTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FA.FADY

datasetVariables.description: 1. Study day of collection, measured as integer days. \n 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Collection
datasetVariables.name: FADY

description: A findings domain that contains the findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an events or interventions domain record or as a supplemental qualifier.
label: Findings About Events or Interventions
name: FA
